poem:
**The Marathon Man**

In the winding years of late age,  
where the clock ticks in softer tones,  
he laced his shoes at eighty-nine,  
whispering the miles with God.  
Twenty sure-footed miles carried him,  
six more in prayerful stride,  
while each step unspooled the yarn of youth,  
a story only he could weave anew.
